title: Quiz 5: Comprehensive Review
description: A final integrated review covering concepts, implementation, responsibilities, and future strategies in Primary Health Care.

questions.question: Which level of health care is correctly identified as the 'focal point' for PHC implementation where decentralization occurs?
questions.explanation: The District Level is the focal point for PHC, managing resources and planning locally.
questions.hint: It is where the DHMT operates.

questions.question: Match the 'Five As' concept with its description:
questions.hint: Link the word to its practical meaning.

questions.question: Which of the following are pillars of PHC? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Equity, Science, and Participatory are pillars. Centralization is contrary to PHC.

questions.question: The ___BLANK___ Declaration of 1978 defined Primary Health Care as essential health care made universally accessible.
questions.explanation: The Alma Ata Declaration is the founding document of PHC.

questions.question: Under the NHSSP, the Ministry of Health encourages communities to participate in the management of health funds.
questions.explanation: The NHSSP promotes decentralization and community participation in managing funds (e.g., through cost-sharing/Bamako Initiative).

questions.question: Review the scenario below. Which level of health care is failing in its responsibility?

richContent.content: Scenario: A Health Centre has run out of essential drugs. The nurse in charge sent a requisition request two months ago, but the supervising body at the district headquarters has not processed it or sent supplies.

questions.explanation: The District Level (DHMT) is responsible for distributing supplies and ensuring health centres are stocked.

questions.question: Order the levels of community involvement from lowest to highest:
questions.explanation: Participation grows from passive reception -> consultation -> active doing -> full ownership/control.
questions.hint: From doing nothing to doing everything.

questions.question: What is the name of the committee chaired by the District Commissioner that includes representatives from all government ministries and NGOs?
questions.explanation: The District Development Committee (DDC) is the main coordinating body.

questions.question: Which of the following are responsibilities of the **Family** in maintaining hygiene? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Families handle personal hygiene (washing, latrines, refuse). Protecting community springs is a Community Level task.

questions.question: Which term describes the shift in emphasis from curative services to preventive/promotive health care?

richContent.content: Concept: Moving resources and focus away from treating the sick to keeping the healthy well.

questions.explanation: The PHC Strategy is defined by this shift towards prevention and promotion.
